author: George Orwell
summary: A novel that tells the story of a dystopian future where truth is manipulated and oppression is accepted.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
summary: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through the eyes of a young girl.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
summary: The narrative of a teenager Holden Caulfield's experiences in New York City.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
summary: A romantic novel of manners that depicts the British Regency-era society.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
summary: A fantasy novel about the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
summary: Ryland Grace, an astronaut with amnesia, is on a desperate mission to save Earth from a solar dimming event. As he regains his memories, he discovers that his survival and humanity's future hinge on his success.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
summary: A dystopian social science fiction novel and a cautionary tale, anticipating huge scientific developments in reproductive technology, sleep-learning, psychological manipulation, and classical conditioning that are combined to make a dystopian society.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: A passionate philosophical novel that enters deeply into the ethical debates of God, free will, and morality. The story of the Karamazov family is a polyphonic and elaborate tale of patricide in 19th century Russia.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
summary: A story of a young man, Dorian Gray, who is the subject of a painting by artist Basil Hallward. Dorian sells his soul to preserve his beauty, and the painting becomes a reflection of his soul's corruption.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
summary: The novel tells the story of the doomed love and revenge of Heathcliff, an orphan, and Catherine Earnshaw, a headstrong woman, set against the backdrop of the Yorkshire moors.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
summary: The novel focuses on the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student in St. Petersburg who formulates and executes a plan to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker for her cash.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
summary: A sprawling novel that tells the story of several characters, primarily focusing on ex-convict Jean Valjean and his struggles for redemption while being pursued by Inspector Javert, set against the backdrop of early 19th-century France.
